title: Lyme teen to appear on "The Voice" tonight
content: A Lyme teenager who has performed at venues and events across the region for more than five years will be Connecticut's only representative on this season's NBC hit "The Voice." Braiden Sunshine, 15, a member of Madison Red, Silver Hammer Band and Stone Creek auditioned in August 2014 in New Jersey, said his mother, Elizabeth. "He's been singing pretty much since he could speak," she said. Braiden is unable to give interviews until after the episode airs. Braiden has performed at venues including the Ledyard Fair, Preston Music Festival and Sprague summer concert series. He's also sang at restaurants in Danielson and Montville, among other places. "The Voice," hosted by Carson Daly, includes celebrity judges Adam Levine, Blake Shelton, Gwen Stefani and Pharrell Williams. It airs at 8 p.m.
